title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 May 2013 - XWiki
content:

07:54 <evalica> has quit  
07:55 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <npm\_> has quit  
09:01 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <npm> has quit  
10:00 <altker128> Hey all. I just followed this page here http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT , to install XWiki-tomcat7-postgresql on a completely clean Debian Wheezy installation.  Tomcat is running but when trying to run XWiki I get these types of errors: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3 in 0: Could not initialize main XWiki context  
10:04 <tmortagne> Hi altker128: will need a more complete log, could you post it on pastebin or something like this  
10:05 <altker128> tmortagne: Yes, one second  
10:06 <altker128> tmortagne: http://pastebin.com/MVNmw8rq  
10:07 <altker128> tmortagne: The error looks similar to the one mentioned in the FreeBSD install guide (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Drafts/BSD\_Install/Error.png) (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/BSD\_Install) , but adding to the catalina file didn't help.  The error you see now is with the default tomcat7 config  
10:07 <tmortagne> altker128: what version of XWiki is this ? 5.0.1 ?  
10:07 <tmortagne> I know this issue but I tough it was fixed  
10:07 <altker128> tmortagne: Yes, 5.01  
10:08 <tmortagne> could you post your /etc/xwiki/hibernate.cfg.xml file content  
10:08 <altker128> yes  
10:09 <altker128> tmortagne: I'll give you the sections that are commented  
10:09 <tmortagne> it looks like XE-1288 is not fully fixed  
10:10 <altker128> tmortagne: http://pastebin.com/b2MCgsqA  
10:10 <tmortagne> yes that's it  
10:10 <tmortagne> look at the end  
10:10 <tmortagne> you have a <mapping> after <property>  
10:11 <tmortagne> that's what the XML parser does not like  
10:11 <altker128> tmortagne: I didn't change the file  
10:11 <tmortagne> trying to find how it ends up in the debian package now...  
10:11 <tmortagne> yes I know  
10:11 <tmortagne> I'm sure it's my fault  
10:11 <tmortagne> try to invert the two elements  
10:11 <altker128> tmortagne: How should I fix it?  
10:12 <tmortagne> the mapping should be before the property  
10:12 <altker128> tmortagne: There are several properties followed by mappings ; do I just put all the mappings first?  
10:13 <altker128> props, mapping, propr, mapping  
10:13 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
10:13 <tmortagne> it's the opposite actually sorry  
10:13 <tmortagne> properties first  
10:14 <altker128> OK, that's what I figured :)  
10:14 <tmortagne> the last property is not in the right place  
10:14 <altker128> Let me fix it  
10:15 <tmortagne> fixing the issue on my side  
10:15 <altker128> OK, it pops up the distribution wizard :)  
10:17 <altker128> tmortagne: Going through the initial UI install  
10:17 <tmortagne> altker128: ok at least this specific issue should be fixed then  
10:18 <altker128> tmortagne: It feels like it's hung...but I'll give it more time  
10:19 <tmortagne> altker128: it's possible it takes some time the first time since it's gathering information from http://nexus.xwiki.org/  
10:20 <altker128> tmortagne: It feels like it's hung  
10:20 <altker128> Resolving extension dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-administration-ui-5.0.1] on namespace [xwiki]  
10:20 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <tmortagne> altker128: sometimes it's because http://www.xwiki.org is not in a good shape but it seems ok right now  
10:21 <altker128> tmortagne: I'll leave it for a bit.  
10:22 <tmortagne> the log is still on "Resolving extension dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-administration-ui-5.0.1] on namespace [xwiki]" ?  
10:22 <altker128> yes  
10:22 <tmortagne> try to refresh maybe  
10:22 <altker128> ok that gave mea  login  
10:23 <altker128> logged in...still going on the UI setup  
10:24 <kstuart> has quit  
10:24 <tmortagne> altker128: the install is also installing users/setup so during the install you loose the right to access the install UI which is why you need to login  
10:24 <tmortagne> but it does not mean the install is done  
10:24 <altker128> tmortagne: If you haev an updated package for me to try, let me know.  I'm using OpenVZ so it's very easy for me to try an updates package  
10:25 <altker128> tmortagne: Thanks, that makes a lot of sense!  
10:25 <altker128> I have to say, I'm REALLY impressed, you and VMassol have been exceptionally responsive in answering questions.  Thank you sincerely for that.  
10:25 <tmortagne> altker128: you'r welcome :)  
10:26 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <altker128> This install was much easier and quicker than trying on FreeBSD.  
10:29 <kstuart> has quit  
10:30 <tmortagne> altker128: yea debian packaging has its charm, would be nice to have contributions for FreeBSD and Redhat packaging  
10:31 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <altker128> tmortagne: I'm trying to add this to my tomcat7 config and when I do I can't start (or restart) tomcat7  
10:31 <altker128> CATALINA\_OPTS="-server -Xms800m -Xmx800m -XX:MaxPermSize=196m -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djava.awt.headless=true -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100"  
10:32 <altker128> I've allocated 2GB (2048MB) to the xwiki CT  
10:32 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <altker128> ah yes  
10:32 <altker128> because it was truncated  
10:33 <altker128> hrm  
10:33 <altker128> no it was not  
10:33 <altker128> CATALINA\_OPTS="-server -Xms800m -Xmx800m -XX:MaxPermSize=196m -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djava.awt.headless=true -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100"  
10:38 <altker128> tmortagne: I notice the response time for clicking on links is on the order of a second or two...is that to be expected?  
10:40 <tmortagne> altker128: could be at the very beginning since a lot of things are initialized lazily but it sounds slow in production  
10:41 <tmortagne> you can look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances  
10:42 <tmortagne> there is a lot of hints in there  
10:46 <altker128> tmortagne: Thanks, I'll look at it.  I still feel the responsiveness is too slow out of the box.  Server is a Core-i7 2GHz w/8GB of RAM  
10:47 <tmortagne> yes the server looks way enough  
10:48 <altker128> tmortagne: OK, thanks for your input, will try more tomorrow.  Must sleep now!  
10:49 <tmortagne> altker128: good night :)

17:40 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
18:23 <tdelafosse> has quit  
18:37 <sburjan`> Hello. I am building an application in XWiki which has several modules inside it. In the master pom they are defined each using <module>. The problem is that I have to skip tests for one of the module, but only for a specified module. Is there a way to make the master pom skip the tests automatically for that module ?  
18:40 <sdumitriu1> sburjan`: Why the master pom?  
18:41 <sdumitriu1> Just specify it in the module's pom  
18:41 <sdumitriu1> <properties><skipTests>true</skipTests></properties>  
18:47 <sburjan`> sdumitriu: works, thanks ! The solutions I found on the internet used the whole surefire declared as a plugin in which tests were skipped. You gave a nice shortcut  
18:48 <mflorea> has quit  
19:07 <Inge-> has quit  
19:10 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
19:54 <draconbo> has joined #xwiki  
20:42 <draconbo> has quit  
21:43 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
22:35 <jbwiv> has joined #xwiki  
22:36 <jbwiv> guys, I'd like to prompt my users for user input for one field, connect to a database external to xwiki, and then display formatted results. I see there is a plugin to execute sql from xwiki, so does this sound possible? If so, how can I avoid storing the password to the database in the source?  
22:58 <jvelo> has quit  
23:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
